009
010package imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace;
011
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.Locale;
014
015import ij.ImageStack;
016import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.util.LinearContainer;
018import imagingbook.common.util.PrintsToStream;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * Represents a single "octave", which is a stack of scale "levels", in a
023 * generic hierarchical scale space. See Sec. 25.1.4. of [1] for details.
024 * Basically this is an array with flexible bottom and top index.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/11/20
033 * @param <LevelT> the scale level type
034 */
035public abstract class ScaleOctave<LevelT extends ScaleLevel> implements PrintsToStream {
036        
037        final int Q;                    // number of levels per doubling scale factor
038        final int p;                    // octave index
039        final int width, height;
040        final int botLevelIndex, topLevelIndex;
041        final LinearContainer<LevelT> levels;
042        final double sigma_0;
043        
044        ScaleOctave(int p, int Q, int width, int height, int botLevelIndex, int topLevelIndex, double sigma_0) {
045                this.p = p;
046                this.Q = Q;
047                this.width = width;
048                this.height = height;
049                if (botLevelIndex > topLevelIndex) 
050                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("ScaleOctave (constructor): botLevelIndex > topLevelIndex");
051                this.botLevelIndex = botLevelIndex;
052                this.topLevelIndex = topLevelIndex;
053                this.sigma_0 = sigma_0;
054                levels = new LinearContainer<>(botLevelIndex, topLevelIndex);
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Returns the index (p) of this scale space octave.
059         * @return the octave index
060         */
061        public int getOctaveIndex() {
062                return p;
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Returns the image width of this scale space octave.
067         * @return the image width
068         */
069        public int getWidth() {
070                return width;
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Returns the image height of this scale space octave.
075         * @return the image height
076         */
077        public int getHeight() {
078                return height;
079        }
080        
081        /**
082         * Returns a reference to the scale level of this octave with the specified index.
083         * @param q the level index
084         * @return a reference to scale level q
085         */
086        public LevelT getLevel(int q) { // TODO: honor bottom level, check q
087                return levels.getElement(q);
088        }
089        
090        // for internal use only
091        void setLevel(int q, LevelT level) {    // TODO: check q
092                levels.setElement(q, level);
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns true iff q is outside the level range and position (u,v) is inside the level's
097         * bounds.
098         * 
099         * @param q the level index
100         * @param u horizontal coordinate
101         * @param v vertical coordinate
102         * @return true iff inside this level
103         */
104        public boolean isInside(int q, int u, int v) {
105                return (botLevelIndex < q && q < topLevelIndex &&
106                                0 < u && u < width-1 && 
107                                0 < v && v < height-1);
108        }
109        
110        /**
111         * Returns the absolute scale (&sigma;) associated with level q.
112         * @param q the level index
113         * @return the absolute scale of the level
114         */
115        public double getAbsoluteScale(int q) {
116                return getLevel(q).getAbsoluteScale();
117        }
118        
119        /**
120         * Returns the bottom level index for this scale space octave
121         * (e.g., this is -1 for the Gaussian scale space used in SIFT).
122         * @return the bottom level index
123         */
124        int getBottomLevelIndex() {
125                return botLevelIndex;
126        }
127        
128        /**
129         * Returns the top level index for this scale space octave
130         * (e.g., this is Q+1 for the Gaussian scale space used in SIFT).
131         * @return the top level index
132         */
133        int getTopLevelIndex() {
134                return topLevelIndex;
135        }
136        
137
138        /**
139         * Returns the absolute scale (&sigma;) for octave index p and
140         * level index q;
141         * 
142         * @param p the octave index
143         * @param q the level index
144         * @return the absolute scale
145         */
146        public double getAbsoluteScale(int p, int q) {
147                double m =  Q * p + q; 
148                double sigma = sigma_0 * Math.pow(2, m/Q);
149                return sigma;
150        }
151        
152        /**
153         * Collects and returns the 3x3x3 neighborhood values from this octave 
154         * at scale level q and center position (u,v). The result is stored
155         * in the supplied 3x3x3 array nh[s][x][y].
156         * 
157         * @param q the level index
158         * @param u the horizontal coordinate
159         * @param v the vertical coordinate
160         * @param nh the 3x3x3 neighborhood array to hold the result
161         */
162        public void getNeighborhood(int q, int u, int v, final float[][][] nh) {
163                // nh[s][x][y]
164                for (int s = 0, li = q - 1; s < 3; s++, li++) {
165                        getLevel(li).get3x3Neighborhood(u, v, nh[s]);
166                }
167        }
168        
169        // ---------------------------------------------------------
170        
171        /**
172         * Returns an ImageJ {@link ImageStack} for this octave which can be
173         * displayed. Frame labels are automatically set.
174         * 
175         * @return an {@link ImageStack} for this octave
176         */
177        public ImageStack getImageStack() {
178                ImageStack stk = new ImageStack(width, height);
179                for (int q = botLevelIndex; q <= topLevelIndex; q++) {
180                        ScaleLevel level = getLevel(q);
181                        if (level != null) {
182                                double scale = level.getAbsoluteScale();
183                                String title = String.format(Locale.US, "q=%d, \u03C3=%.4f", q, scale);
184                                FloatProcessor fp = level.toFloatProcessor();
185                                fp.resetMinAndMax();
186                                stk.addSlice(title, fp);
187                        }
188                }
189                return stk;
190        }
191        
192        @Override
193        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
194                strm.println("  Scale Octave p=" + p);
195                for (int q = botLevelIndex; q <= topLevelIndex; q++) {
196                        ScaleLevel level = getLevel(q);
197                        if (level != null) {
198                                double scale = level.getAbsoluteScale();
199                                strm.format(Locale.US, "   level (p=%d, q=%d, scale=%.4f)\n", p, q, scale);
200                        }
201                }
202        }
203        
204}
